snippet: At a church in Cincinnati, dozens of people traded in their guns for $100 gift cards in a program to reduce violence, although the effectiveness of buybacks has been questioned.
abstract: Dan Barry This Land column describes scene at President Drive Church of Christ in Cincinnati, where dozens of people traded in their guns for $100 gift cards; program has bought back 145 guns, but effectiveness of buybacks in reducing violence has been questioned.
lead_paragraph: At a church in Cincinnati, dozens of people traded in their guns for $100 gift cards in a program to reduce violence, although the effectiveness of buybacks has been questioned.

headline.print_headline: A Pastor Offers Gift Cards for Guns, in Hopes of Saving a Life or Two
headline.seo: Guns Are Given Up for Gift Cards — This Land
headline.main: Steps to Disarm (Get Gift Card) at Ohio Church
